intro: Haberlea rhodopensis, commonly known as the rock rose or rock orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Bulgaria. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing drought tolerance and succulent leaves. It blooms in spring, producing pink to purple flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and as a houseplant.
